NODE_TEXT: The discrepancy analysis is used for fail-safe inputs in order to detect errors from the temporal characteristic of two signals with identical functionality. The discrepancy analysis is started if different levels are determined for two associated input signals. A test is run to see whether the difference disappears once a configurable period of time known as the discrepancy time has elapsed. If not, there is a discrepancy error. Monitoring of the discrepancy time extends the system response time.
Q: Can the discrepancy time be adjusted based on system requirements?
A: Yes, the discrepancy time is configurable to suit specific system needs and tolerance levels.
